gov.usgs.anss.util

Class SimpleSMTPThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.util.SimpleSMTPThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class SimpleSMTPThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    simpleSMTP.java - This class is used to send a simple mail message (no attachments, etc. just subject and text body) to a SMTP server. The main thread does the sending and an inner class reads data back from the smtp server. A StringBuilder is maintained with details of the session so a user could inspect or use it

    The property SMTPServer is used to send the mail. If this is set to "mailx" then mailx is used to send the mail via a batch file created in the temporary area.

    Created on August 20, 2003, 4:56 PM

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  SimpleSMTPThread.GetSession
      This inner class monitors the input side of the SMTP socket and adds any text received from the server to the session log.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleSMTPThread

        public SimpleSMTPThread(java.lang.String serverin,
                        java.lang.String to_in,
                        java.lang.String from_in,
                        java.lang.String subject_in,
                        java.lang.String body_in)
        Create a object and send the mail message to he server. This creates a thread which sends the message and spawns an inner class which monitors and records the responses of the SMTP server. If subject line contains 'DBG' then debugging output of the thread will be turned on.
        Parameters:
        serverin - The SMTP server machine to use (port 25)
        to_in - The email address of the recipient
        from_in - The email address of the sender
        subject_in - The subject line
        body_in - The main body of the message

      • SimpleSMTPThread

        public SimpleSMTPThread(java.lang.String serverin,
                        java.lang.String to_in,
                        java.lang.String from_in,
                        java.lang.String subject_in,
                        java.lang.String body_in,
                        boolean alt)
        Create a object and send the mail message to he server. This creates a thread which sends the message and spawns an inner class which monitors and records the responses of the SMTP server. If subject line contains 'DBG' then debugging output of the thread will be turned on.
        Parameters:
        serverin - The SMTP server machine to use (port 25)
        to_in - The email address of the recipient
        from_in - The email address of the sender
        subject_in - The subject line
        body_in - The main body of the message
        alt - If true use alternate

      • setDebug

        public static void setDebug(boolean t)

      • run

        public void run()
        this is the main body of the sending thread. It interacts with the SMTP server in the normal manner and monitors responses of the server via a GetSession inner class object. Beware per http://pobox.com/~djb/docs/smtplf.html sending linefeeds without preceding carriage returns can result in rejections of mail by some servers per a RFP spec. We spent much time running this down!
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • waitForDone

        public void waitForDone()
        wait for the SMTP mail session to complete. This will sleep the caller until the SMTP session has completed. At the time of the return the session text will be complete

      • wasSuccessful

        public boolean wasSuccessful()
        Return whether the mail message appeared to go out successfully to the server
        Returns:
        If true, the message was sent

      • getSendMailError

        public java.lang.String getSendMailError()
        Return a String with a record of the SMTP session. Normally only used for debugging the send.
        Returns:
        The session string
